intro: Polygala parviloba, commonly known as the small-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. It produces small, bead-like fruits that contain the seeds. Polygala parviloba is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
